description: Unadapted borrowing from German Poltergeist, from poltern (“to rumble”) +‎ Geist (“ghost”).

entries.meaning: (parapsychology) An unseen ghost which makes noises and causes disruption, especially by causing physical objects to move or fly about.
examples: A poltergeist haunts the house by moving objects around, making chain-rattling noises and throwing things.
The chapel is haunted by a demonic poltergeist.
